intro: Galium luteocruciatum, commonly known as the yellow cruciate bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, sprawling stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium luteocruciatum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is notable for its delicate appearance and ecological role in supporting insect life.
